skill.name: venue-templates
skill.description: Access comprehensive LaTeX templates, formatting requirements, and submission guidelines for major scientific publication venues (Nature, Science, PLOS, IEEE, ACM), academic conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR, CHI), research posters, and grant proposals (NSF, NIH, DOE, DARPA). This skill should be used when preparing manuscripts for journal submission, conference papers, research posters, or grant proposals and need venue-specific formatting requirements and templates.
skill.summary: Access comprehensive LaTeX templates, formatting requirements, and submission guidelines for major s...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or exfiltration patterns found. Scripts read local templates and run local PDF tools without network calls.

content.value_statement: Preparing submissions across venues is slow and error prone. This skill delivers templates, requirements summaries, and format checks to speed compliant papers, posters, and grants.
actual_capabilities: List available journal, conference, poster, and grant templates
Search templates by venue or keyword and show requirements
Customize LaTeX placeholders for title, authors, affiliations, and email
Validate PDF page count, fonts, and margin guidance using pdfinfo and pdffonts
Provide bundled templates for Nature, NeurIPS, PLOS, NSF, NIH, and posters
limitations: Covers only the bundled venues and templates
PDF validation depends on external tools and cannot fully verify margins
Does not compile LaTeX or create figures
Requirements summaries may need confirmation against current venue websites

use_cases.title: Submit a first journal paper
use_cases.description: Pick a journal template, apply author details, and review page and font limits.

use_cases.title: Prepare a double blind paper
use_cases.description: Retrieve venue requirements and ensure anonymization and page limits match the call.

use_cases.title: Draft an NSF proposal
use_cases.description: Start from the NSF template and confirm page limits and section requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Find a template
prompt_templates.scenario: New user needs a venue template
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the LaTeX template and key requirements for PLOS ONE.

prompt_templates.title: Customize fields
prompt_templates.scenario: Add author details to a template
prompt_templates.prompt: Customize the Nature template with title, authors, affiliations, and email. Output the updated file name.

prompt_templates.title: Check a PDF
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate my_paper.pdf for NeurIPS and report page count, margins guidance, and fonts.

prompt_templates.title: Compare venues
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare formatting requirements for Nature and Science and summarize the major differences.

output_examples.input: Help me format a NeurIPS paper and list key requirements.
output: Template: neurips_article.tex is the recommended starting point.
Page limit: 8 pages for main text, references are unlimited.
Format: two column, 10 point font, anonymization required.
Next step: customize title and author fields, then compile to PDF.

best_practices: Verify the venue website for the latest author instructions
Compile the template before adding content to catch errors early
Keep a clean copy of the original template for comparison
anti_patterns: Editing the template to change required margins or fonts
Skipping anonymization checks for double blind venues
Submitting without validating page count and font usage

faq.question: Which platforms can use this skill?
faq.answer: It works in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code with local file access.

faq.question: How many venues are included?
faq.answer: The bundle covers key journals, conferences, posters, and grant agencies listed in the references.

faq.question: Can I integrate it into my LaTeX workflow?
faq.answer: Yes, use the scripts to generate files, then compile with your usual LaTeX tools.

faq.question: Does it collect or send my data?
faq.answer: No. It reads local templates and does not make network calls.

faq.question: What if pdfinfo or pdffonts is missing?
faq.answer: Font and page checks are skipped; install poppler tools for full validation.

faq.question: How does it compare to a general LaTeX helper?
faq.answer: It focuses on venue-specific requirements and bundled templates, not general LaTeX editing.
